snippet: Ahmed Shafik, who had supported the military takeover, said the voting would be fixed, an almost heretical expression of cynicism from a member of the military elite.
abstract: Ahmed Shafik, former Egyptian prime minister, general and supporter of military takeover, can be heard in recorded and leaked conversation calling free elections promised by military government 'farce'; Shafik says he will not run because he knows election will be fixed in favor of Field Marshal Abdel Fattah el-Sisi; Shafik's comments represent rare hint of dissent among business and military elite.
lead_paragraph: Ahmed Shafik, who had supported the military takeover, said the voting would be fixed, an almost heretical expression of cynicism from a member of the military elite.

headline.main: Former Egyptian General Calls Promise of Free Elections a ‘Farce’
headline.print_headline: Ex-General Sees Election as a ‘Farce’ for Egypt

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
